title: Nike Air Jordan 1 “University Blue” — US9

listingInfo.title: Nike Air Jordan 1 Retro High OG “University Blue” — 100% Authentic
listingInfo.disclosedFlaws: Minor crease on toe box (photo 3), slightly dented box
listingInfo.attributes: US9 (27cm), with original box & tag, purchased at Nike Taipei, 2023 release

complaint: Buyer says item fits like US8.5 though box says US9.

chatLog.text: Hi! Is this pair still available? Looks really clean.
Yes, still available. Worn twice indoors, soles are very clean.
Is the sizing true? I usually wear US9 for other Jordan 1s.
Yep, true US9. I wear US9 too and it fits snugly.
Cool. If you can do NT$5,000, I’ll take it.
Deal.
Ship via 7-ELEVEN COD, I’ll cover shipping.
Sure, COD fee is NT$60, paid at pickup.
Send it to 7-ELEVEN Dunbei (Songshan), please.
Okay, I’ll ship tomorrow morning.
Order created (Order ID: TW-11021).
I just tried them — they fit like US8.5, not US9. I want a return + refund.
That’s strange. I also wear US9 and they fit me fine.
They’re tighter than my other pairs. Can I send them back?

Dispute received.
→ Checking external product data for “Air Jordan 1 University Blue”…

Sources indicate this model runs about 0.5 size smaller than standard AJ1s; many buyers report the same.
→ Neither party is at fault (product characteristic).

Recommendation:
A) Return & Full Refund (Buyer covers NT$60 shipping)
B) Keep item with a partial refund (~10%).
Oh, I see. Then it’s not your fault either.
I can refund NT$500 as goodwill if you keep them.
That’s fair. I’ll keep them.
Recorded — both parties agreed on partial refund (NT$500). Dispute resolved amicably.
